reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Scaling Up Innovative Approaches to Respond to TB Challenges and Strengthening Health Systems Initiatives in Afghanistan

description.narrative: Afghanistan - Tuberculosis - United Nations Development Programme - UNDP Afghanistan. This program has the following goals: To reduce TB deaths by 75% by the end of 2025 compared to 2015. To decrease incidence rate by 20% by 2024 (to reach 50% reduction in incidence rate compared to 2015) in order to be aligned with End TB Strategy. To strengthen the health system to reduce mortality and morbidity associated with ATM and RMNCH. The objectives of this program are: To increase the case notification of all TB cases at least 12% annually until 2023 and maintain full coverage thereafter, and to sustain treatment success rate, at least, 90% by 2025. To detect and treat at least 80% of estimated MDR-TB cases by 2025. To detect and treat at least 50% of the estimated latent TB cases as the accumulation by 2025. To increase access of women and children to health care services for RMNCAH, HIV, TB and malaria, reduced stigma and discrimination and promotion of health lifestyles in the community and in health facilities in underserved areas. To maintain and improve the quality of the National Laboratory Network. To improve institutional capacity of Civil Society Organizations and private sector for effective implementation of TB, Malaria and HIV. To ensure high quality pharmaceuticals and health commodities by strengthening the supply chain, procurement, management, Quality Assurance and regulatory systems. To improve the data quality of the HMIS and strengthen the utilization of data for decision-making at all levels

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for AFG-T-UNDP
Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses
Percentage of TB patients with DST result for at least Rifampicin among the total number of notified (new and retreatment) cases in the same year

LAB-Other3: Percentage of provincial laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance among the total number of laboratories that undertake bacteriology services during the reporting period
Percentage of notified TB cases, all forms, contributed by non-NTP providers - community referrals
SD-Other2: Number of people receiving services through Public-Private Partnerships (PPPs)

RSSH-Other 3: Percentage of provincial laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance among the total number of laboratories that undertake bacteriology services during the reporting period
Percentage of notified TB cases, all forms, contributed by non-NTP providers - private/non-governmental facilities
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among key affected populations/ high risk groups (other than prisoners)
Percentage of previously treated TB patients receiving DST (bacteriologically positive cases only)

Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake smear microscopy during the reporting period

RSSH-Other2: Percentage of regional laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance among the total number of laboratories that undertake available services during the reporting period
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among key affected populations/high risk groups
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines

LAB-Other2: Percentage of regional laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance among the total number of laboratories that undertake available services during the reporting period
RSSH-Other1: Number of people receiving services through Public-Private Partnerships (PPPs)
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – private/non-governmental facilities
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
